result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and then leave immediately thereafter.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy. 
Sign necessary releases to monitor any controlled substances that might be prescribed. 
Provide a DNA sample if not already done so.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if he has not had one in the past 12 months.  If he has, then he is to be in strict compliance with treatment recommendations and provide proof to his agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.
Comply with all conditions in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.

Huber for any employment, treatment or counseling that he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Must report today for start date.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CF73 Count 4.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission
for Sentence Credit - original filed in 15CF73
of the Court /s/ TTF 01/28/16

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF261, 14CF262, 14CF314, 14CF349, 14CF359, 14CF455, 15CF73, 15CF333, 15CF405, 15TR424, 15TR425
1:41 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF333 Counts 1 thru 3 - NO CONTEST
15CF73 Counts 1 thru 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF333 Counts 1 thru 3, 15CF73 Counts 1 thru 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed & Read-In: 
15CF405
14CF455
14CF359
14CF349 
14CF314
14CF262
14CF261
15TR424
15TR425

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF333 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and then leave immediately thereafter. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases to monitor any controlled substances that might be prescribed.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if he has not had one in the past 12 months.  If he has, then he is to be in strict compliance with treatment recommendations and provide proof to his agent. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Provide a DNA sample if not already done so. 

15CF333 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with Count 1:
Comply with all conditions in Count 1. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
 
15CF333 Count 3 - 
Serve 90 days jail. 
Consecutive to 15CF73 Count 4.
Huber for any employment, treatment or counseling that he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Must report today for start date. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.

15CF73 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with other probations he is on:
Comply with all conditions in 15CF333 Count 1. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF73 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 4 years, concurrent with other probations he is on:
Comply with all conditions in 15CF333 Count 1. 
Pay fine of $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF73 Count 3 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent with other probations he is on:
Serve 45 days in jail. 
Huber for employment and counseling or treatment he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Court finds there is sufficient pre-trial incarceration credit.  
Must report today for start date.  
Pay fine and costs totaling $3,214.00.
33 months revocation of license.
33 months IID. 
DOT Assessment must be completed and comply with all treatment recommendations. 

15CF73 Count 4 - 
Serve 270 days jail. 
Consecutive to 15CF73 Count 3. 
Huber for employment and any counseling or treatment he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Required to continue to day report to be sure he is in compliance with PTSP that he has been placed on so that he does not end up being revoked before he starts his jail sentences because of non-compliance. 
First half must be in jail with the second half on GPS monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Must report today for start date. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF73 Count 5 - 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Attorneys to file stipulation with the court and the jail with regards to jail credit.

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in custody. Elizabeth R Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF405 and 15CF333.

11:07 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Continuation of hearing where motion was filed to modify bond and allow defendant to be on Pre-Trial Release/Pre-Trial Home Detention Progam.
Assessment has been completed by Deputy Borski and all parties have received their copies.
Atty Drengler makes his argument regarding his motion.
Atty Constable objects to motion and states her argument on the record.
Atty Drengler replies to the argument of Atty Constable.
Court has reviewed all files and assessments.

BY THE COURT:
Court DENIES the bond modification.
Motion hearing at 12-21-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:36 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Both files heard: 15CF333, 15CF405

Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court will continue this matter to another date as the Court cannot continue this matter without an assessment. 
Defendant makes additional statements to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court. 
  Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing at 01-05-2016 01:30 pm
Bail/Bond Review at 12-11-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-405 and 15CF-333.

11:48 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Atty Renc appears for Atty Drengler today.

This is a motion from the defense for a motion to modify bond.

Atty Renc addresses the court regarding the motion, requests the pretrial home detntion program.

Procedure for pretrial home detention is handed out to both counsel, from the Court.
Court addresses this request by the defense, states where the process is at this time, with regards to this new program.

The program is in the first step or stage.
This is the only second attempt for pretrial home detention. There was one other request in Branch 1.

Atty Renc addresses the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Court will take this under consideration. This may be an appropriate case for home detention. At this point Court does not have the information to make a final decision.

(bond)

10/12/15 - Bond is amended from day report to Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming. All other conditions remain.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
4:02 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Atty Drengler
Initial Appearance held 9/8/15

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:07 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Constable makes statements to the Court.  Day report is asking for clarification on the bond conditions.  Asks to clarify how many days he is to report, noting the defendant is self employed. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Constable asks that bond be ordered as originally set. 
Atty Drengler makes arguments to the Court.  Indicates 14 times per week is an issue. 

Court notes they are dealing with this file and this file only. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court states his reasons for ordering 14 times per week. That is the order in this file.  He is to day report 14 times per week.  THe modification by Judge Fleishauer is no longer valid and the bond is reverted to what was originally ordered.
Preliminary hearing at 10-12-2015 03:00 pm
Preliminary hearing at 10-14-2015 03:00 pm

BTC: $2,500 cash bond:  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Comply with bonds in all pending cases.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  14

9/8/15 bond amended to add that he comply the Pre-trial supervision program with the understanding day report was determined at 14 days per week with an allowable exception for employ.  Project manager has discretion to change those conditions.

Defendant Jacob B. Sniadajewski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Atty Drengler makes bond arguments to the Court.  Asks day report be reduced to 7 days and asks the case manager be giving discretion to lower that. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court does not modify with that regard. But adds that he comply the Pre-trial supervision program with the understanding day report was determined at 14 days per week with an allowable exception for employ.  Project manager has discretion to change those conditions. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
